titleInfo.title: Two treatises on gnomonics Ibn al-Raqqām, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ابن الرقام، محمد بن ابراهيم

physicalDescription.extent: Material: PaperDimensions: 258 x 165 mm leaf [210 x 128 mm written]Foliation: British Museum foliation in pencilRuling: Misṭarah; 21 lines per page; vertical spacing 10 lines per 10 cmScript: MaghribīInk: BlackBinding: British Museum bindingCondition: Waterstains, leaves repaired at edges; lower half of f. 30 has been badly damaged by waters and wormsMarginalia: Occasional

mods.abstract: Two treatises on the construction and use of sundials by the Andalusian scholar Abū ʿAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn ʿAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf al-Mursī al-Andalusī al-Tūnisī al-Awsī ibn al-Raqqām (عبد الله محمد بن إبراهيم بن علي بن أحمد بن يوسف المرسي الأندلسي التونسي الأوسي بن الرقام, d. 1315).Although the copy is undated, the use of the phrase 'may God prolong his life and brighten his sky with benefic stars (أدام الله حياته وأنار بنجوم السعد سمائه)' after the author's name (f. 1v, lines 5-6) indicates that it was copied before the death of the author in 715 AH/AD 1315.The title page (f. 1r) reads Kitāb al-ẓilāl(كتاب الظلال).Contents:(1) Ibn al-Raqqām (ابن الرقام), Risālah fī ʿilm al-ẓalālāt(رسالة في علم الظلالات; ff. 1v-29v);(2) Ibn al-Raqqām (ابن الرقام), ʿAmal ʿāmm fī ʿamal ālāt al-iẓlāl(عمل عام في عمل آلات الإظلال; ff. 30r-30v).
